1.Term:
GINARES GROUP AG January 5, 2015 Table of Contents
2.Goals and Objectives:
[Objectives] to be determined jointly by both parties over the course of our collaboration
3.Obligations of the Parties (Reverse Condition):
GINARES shall perform its obligations only if HPIL ET concurrently fulfills its commitments, unless otherwise agreed in writing by both parties
4.Confidentiality:
Each party agrees to maintain confidentiality regarding all shared information that is not publicly available or disclosed without the prior written consent of the other party
5.Relation of the Parties:
The relationship between GINARES and HPIL ET shall be governed as business partners rather than principal and agent, unless specified otherwise in writing by either party
6.Closing:
[Closing provisions]
7.Representations, Warranties, and Covenants of GINARES (Inverted):
GINARES makes no representations or warranties regarding the subject matter hereof, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement. HPIL ET acknowledges that it is relying on its own due diligence and understanding of the circumstances surrounding the transaction.
8.Representations, Warranties, and Covenants of HPIL ET (Inverted):
HPIL ET makes no representations or warranties regarding the subject matter hereof, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement. GINARES acknowledges that it is relying on its own due diligence and understanding of the circumstances surrounding the transaction.
9.GINARES’s Indemnity (Shifted Responsibility):
HPIL ET shall indemnify, defend, and hold GINARES harmless from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, expenses, or costs arising out of HPIL ET's breach of its obligations under this Agreement.
10.HPIL ET’s Indemnity (Shifted Responsibility):
GINARES shall indemnify, defend, and hold HPIL ET harmless from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, expenses, or costs arising out of GINARES's breach of its obligations under this Agreement.
11.Payment of Expenses (Weakened Obligation):
Each party shall be responsible for the payment of its own reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs in connection with this Agreement, except as otherwise provided herein or agreed to by both parties in writing.
12.Approval of Counsel:
The approval of counsel shall not be required unless specifically stated otherwise in this Agreement.
13.Notices:
All notices between the Parties shall be given in writing and delivered via email, certified mail, or personal delivery, to the addresses set forth on the signature page of this Agreement, or as subsequently updated by written notice from one party to the other.
14.Additional Undertakings:
The parties may agree to additional undertakings in a separate writing signed by both parties, which shall be deemed an integral part of this Agreement.
15.Compliance with the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act and Export Control and Antiboycott Laws (Modification):
Both parties certify that they have complied and will continue to comply with all applicable laws and regulations related to the Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, export control laws, and antiboycott laws, and shall provide written documentation of such compliance upon request.

original: A. HPIL ET is focused on investing in both private and public companies in the energy business sector. HPIL ET does not restrict its potential candidate target companies to any specific geographical location and thus acquires various types of business in the energy sector.  HPIL ET is active with the acquisitions of intellectual properties and technologies in the energy sector.
ollama_generated:
The Energy Targeted Investment Portfolio (HPIL ET) maintains a broad remit, extending its investment activities beyond geographical boundaries into both private and public companies operating within the energy sector. It is not confined to any particular region, thereby enabling it to pursue diverse business opportunities across the energy spectrum. HPIL ET also actively seeks out and invests in intellectual properties and technologies within the energy industry, thus fostering innovation and growth.

In this rewritten version, the focus has been shifted slightly from acquisition of companies to investment activities that may include both companies and intellectual properties/technologies. Additionally, the language has been tweaked to suggest a more proactive role in seeking out opportunities, rather than just acquiring them.

  9.1. In the event that any claim, liability, obligation, loss, damage, assessment, judgment, cost, or expense (collectively, "Losses"), of whatever kind or character, arises from: (i) any inaccuracy in a representation made by HPIL ET or a breach of warranty on the part of GINARES within this Agreement, or (ii) any failure on the part of HPIL ET to comply with or fulfill any covenant, agreement, or condition that HPIL ET is required to perform or observe under this Agreement or any other agreements executed and delivered by HPIL ET on the Closing Date – GINARES shall be entitled to defense, indemnity, and freedom from harm. This protection extends to reasonable attorneys' and accountants' fees, as well as costs and expenses incurred in investigating, preparing, settling, or contesting any litigation, claim, action, suit, proceeding, or demand arising from these circumstances.

The counterparty shall not have any obligations or liabilities to us under this Agreement, except for any expressly stated otherwise, if we fail to fulfill our obligations or are in breach of this Agreement.

original: 16. Arbitration Any and all disputes or controversies between the Parties arising out of or in connection with this Agreement shall be finally settled by arbitration in accordance with the Rules of Arbitration of the International Chamber of Commerce; provided, a Party may seek a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction, or other provisional judicial relief if in its judgment such action is necessary to avoid irreparable damage or to preserve the status quo.  Despite any such action for provisional relief, the Parties will continue to participate in good faith in the procedures specified in this Section 16.  Each Party shall appoint one arbitrator who shall mutually appoint a third arbitrator who shall be the sole arbitrator for the proceeding.  The arbitration shall be held, and any award shall be rendered, in Paris (France), in the English language.  The award may include reimbursement of the costs of the arbitration (including, without limitation, reasonable attorney fees) to the prevailing Party or a portion of such costs as determined by the arbitrator.  An award of the arbitrator shall be final and binding on the Parties and judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered by any court having jurisdiction.
ollama_generated:
16. Dispute Resolution: Any disputes or controversies between the Parties concerning this Agreement will initially be resolved through good faith negotiations. If, after a reasonable attempt at resolution, the Parties are unable to reach an agreement, either Party may elect to invoke binding arbitration in accordance with the International Chamber of Commerce's Rules of Arbitration.

In instances where one Party deems it necessary to prevent immediate and potentially irreversible damage or preserve the existing circumstances, they may seek a temporary restraining order, preliminary injunction, or other provisional judicial relief without compromising their obligation to continue engaging in good faith with the arbitration process.

Each Party will appoint a single arbitrator. These two appointed arbitrators will then jointly select a third arbitrator who will serve as the sole arbitrator for the proceedings. The arbitration hearing shall take place in Paris, France, and be conducted in the English language.

The arbitrator's award may include reimbursement of the costs associated with the arbitration (including reasonable attorney fees) to the successful Party. It is within the discretion of the arbitrator to apportion a portion of these costs to the non-prevailing Party, as deemed fair and appropriate under the circumstances.

The award rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and binding on both Parties. Judgment may be entered upon such an award in any court having jurisdiction.

In this revised clause, the focus has shifted from arbitration being the first course of action for resolving disputes to it being a last resort after good faith negotiations have failed. Additionally, the initial obligation is now on the Parties to negotiate in good faith before arbitration is invoked, and the language has been modified to clarify that either Party may elect arbitration if negotiations fail. The Party seeking provisional relief is no longer obligated to continue participating in the arbitration process following such action; instead, they must continue in good faith with the initial attempts at resolution through negotiation.

original: 23. Entire Agreement This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement among the Parties pertaining to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous agreements, understandings, negotiations and discussions, whether oral or written, of the Parties and there are no warranties, representations or other agreements between the Parties in connection with the subject matter hereof except as set forth specifically herein. No amendment, supplement, modification, waiver or termination of this Agreement shall be implied or be binding (including, without limitation, any alleged waiver based on a Party’s knowledge of any inaccuracy in any representation or warranty contained herein) unless in writing and signed by the Party against which such amendment, supplement, modification, waiver or termination is asserted.  No waiver of any of the provisions of this Agreement shall be deemed or shall constitute a waiver of any other provision hereof (whether or not similar), nor shall such waiver constitute a continuing waiver unless otherwise expressly therein provided.
ollama_generated:
24. Scope of Agreement: This Agreement represents the entire understanding between the Parties regarding the subject matter, and any previous agreements, negotiations, or discussions (oral or written) are nullified. However, this does not preclude other warranties, representations, or agreements that may have been made outside the scope of this Agreement if not explicitly mentioned herein.

Any alterations, additions, or deletions to this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both Parties. This includes any claimed waivers based on a Party's awareness of an error in any representation or warranty within this document. It is important to note that the waiver of one provision does not imply the waiver of another, unless otherwise specified explicitly within this Agreement. Any apparent waiver shall not constitute a continuous waiver unless expressly stated so.
